description: '''Ángel Custodio Loyola''' (September 4, 1926 – September 24, 1985), was a [[Venezuela]]n singer and composer, known as a pioneer in the [[joropo]] genre.  He wrote many popular songs, including "El Gavilán", "Tierra Negra", "Carnaval", "Sentimiento Llanero", "Catira Marmoleña", "Faenas Llaneras", and "Puerto Miranda". He is considered to have been one of the greatest exponents of ''llanera'' music.
